meanings.definition: To make global or worldwide in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: The company is globalizing its operations to reach customers worldwide.
meanings.sent2: The internet has played a key role in globalizing communication across the globe.
meanings.sent3: By globalizing their product line, the company hopes to attract customers from all corners of the world.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for travel is globalizing, expanding to encompass destinations far beyond her home country.
meanings.sent5: The idea of globalizing education is to ensure that students have access to diverse perspectives and knowledge from around the world.

meanings.definition: To extend to all parts of the world.
meanings.sent1: The pandemic quickly globalized, affecting countries on every continent.
meanings.sent2: The spread of social media platforms has globalized the sharing of information and ideas.
meanings.sent3: The trend of globalizing fashion has led to a mix of styles from different cultures on runways worldwide.
meanings.sent4: His influence as a musician globalized, reaching fans in remote corners of the globe.
meanings.sent5: The concept of globalizing healthcare involves ensuring access to medical services for people in all regions of the world.
